title: Fix admin dashboard activity feed to show all user activities

requirements.text: Remove the ActivityFeed component from the main home page (HomeServices.tsx) so that no recent activity is displayed to regular users

quotes: i don't want to show any recent activity on main page

acceptanceCriteria: The ActivityFeed component is no longer rendered on the HomeServices page
Regular users visiting the home page do not see any activity feed

requirements.text: Modify the admin dashboard Messages tab to display all activity messages including worker registrations, material listings, and requirement submissions with proper parsing and rendering

quotes: all the activities of all users, should show on admin dashboard, which is not showing. when my friend try to ragister as worker, listing material or sending requirement

acceptanceCriteria: Admin Messages tab shows all messages from the backend without filtering
Worker registration activities are visible in the admin dashboard
Material listing activities are visible in the admin dashboard
Requirement submission activities are visible in the admin dashboard
Messages are sorted by timestamp in descending order (newest first)
Each message displays its source/origin clearly using AdminMessageRenderer

requirements.text: Ensure the backend getAllMessages query returns all message records without any filtering so the admin dashboard receives complete activity data

quotes: all the activities of all users, should show on admin dashboard, which is not showing

acceptanceCriteria: getAllMessages query returns every message in the messages array
No messages are filtered or excluded from the response
Messages include all types: worker registrations, material listings, career applications, architect projects, and contact requests

constraints: Do not modify the AdminMessageRenderer component logic
Preserve the existing message data structure in the backend
Maintain admin authorization checks for the Messages tab
nonGoals: Adding filtering or search capabilities to the Messages tab
Modifying the appearance or styling of message cards
Creating new message types or activity categories
